The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit, with slender stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, which bloom during the cooler months. Ruprechtia howardiana is adapted to harsh, high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
